mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Wood, James, 1741-1813
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Looks forward to the changes to take place in the state's penal laws; the law provides for the purchase of land and the erection of prison buildings; those responsibile for the execution of the law are unable to decide upon the proper plan of the prison building; asks Jefferson for his assistance in this.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Jefferson, Thomas, 1743-1826--Correspondence
mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, 1797 March 3, [Richmond, Virginia] to Tho[mas] Jefferson, n.p.
